metadata.title: CVE-2019-20907 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Lib/tarfile.py in Python through 3.8.3, an attacker is able to craft aTAR archive leading to an infinite loop when opened by tarfile.open,because _proc_pax lacks header validation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20907` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm6').
python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
